name: CTF Lab
description: Time to put your Linux skills to the test! Complete 18 progressive Capture The Flag challenges covering file navigation, permissions, networking, and more.
short_description: Complete 18 hands-on Linux CTF challenges in a real cloud environment to prove your command line skills.

learning_steps.text: Go to the Linux CTFs Repository
learning_steps.title: Linux CTFs Repository
learning_steps.description: The repository README has everything you need: setup instructions for AWS/Azure/GCP, challenge descriptions, and tips. Follow the instructions there to deploy and complete the challenges.

• Use `man` pages to learn commands (e.g., `man find`)
• Combine commands with pipes (`|`) to process output
• Use `verify hint [num]` when stuck on a challenge
• Experiment freely—you can't break anything permanently
• Don't share solutions publicly—share your learning journey instead

questions.prompt: Walk me through how you would use the find command to locate files on a Linux system.
scenario_seeds: A log file is filling up disk space somewhere on the server but you don't know which directoryâ€”find all files larger than 100MB modified in the last day
An application is failing because a config file was moved during a migration and you need to locate all .conf files owned by the app user
Your security scan found files with dangerous permissions (777) and you need to locate and fix all of them across the entire filesystem
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain basic find syntax with path AND demonstrate filtering options (-name, -type, -size) AND show understanding of combining criteria or using -exec for actions.

questions.prompt: What commands would you use to inspect running processes and network connections on a Linux server?
scenario_seeds: A server is running slowly and you need to identify which process is consuming the most CPU and memory
Your application won't start because something is already listening on port 8080 and you need to find and stop it
During an incident, you need to determine which processes have active network connections to an external IP address
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain process inspection tools (ps, top) AND network connection tools (netstat, ss) AND demonstrate ability to identify PIDs and take action.

test_knowledge_prompts: I just completed the Linux CTF challenges. Can you quiz me on what I learned about file navigation and hidden files?
Can you ask me about Linux file permissions and how chmod works?
Can you quiz me on how to find files using the find command?
Can you ask me about Linux processes and how to inspect them?
Can you quiz me on basic networking commands like netstat and ss?

learning_objectives.text: How to deploy a cloud lab environment
How to solve CTF challenges using cloud skills
How to properly clean up cloud resources to avoid charges
